text: St Anne's Churchyard, also known as St Anne’s Gardens, is a public park on Wardour Street in Soho, London. Formerly the churchyard of St Anne's, Soho, it was closed to burials in 1853. It was laid out as a garden by the Metropolitan Public Gardens Association in 1891. It is managed by Westminster City Council and has received the Green Flag Award. The gardens contain a memorial to the victims of the 1999 Admiral Duncan pub bombing. ==References== Category:Soho, London
title: St Anne's Churchyard
